channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Musk Email Reaches Italian Workers. It Did Not Go Well.
item.description: Employees at the Aviano Air Base who serve American forces got a familiar demand to list their achievements. Unions say Italy “is not the Wild West li...

item.title: Government deficit rose 4% in Trump’s first full month in office, despite DOGE. UBS says the U.S. is slashing confidence, not spending
item.description: While the government did cut its outlays in February the budget deficit for the month more than doubled compared to January due to a drop in income.

item.title: OpenAI points to China as reason why it should escape copyright rules and state-level AI bills in the U.S.
item.description: Sam Altman's outfit argues that the U.S. will lose its AI lead if it doesn't make life easier for companies like his.

item.title: White House Withdraws Nominee for C.D.C. Director
item.description: Dr. Dave Weldon was to have appeared on Thursday in a confirmation hearing before the Senate health committee. He has close ties to Robert F. Kennedy ...

item.title: Putin Visits Kursk to Cheer Russian Troops Trying to Oust Ukraine
item.description: The trip comes as President Trump looks to secure the Russian leader’s support for a 30-day cease-fire.

item.title: Apple shares are losing haven allure as headwinds deter bulls
item.description: The Nasdaq 100 Index is down 7% in 2025, and Apple is responsible for nearly a fifth of that decline, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.

item.title: Bardella, Leader of France’s Far-Right National Rally, Heads to Israel
item.description: As Jordan Bardella, its young president, tries to distance the party from its history of antisemitism, it is making common cause with Israel against “...

item.title: Democratic Attorneys General Sue Over Gutting of Education Department
item.description: The Trump administration cut about half the agency’s work force, saying the move would enable it to deliver services more effectively. The attorneys g...

item.title: Canadian founder insists his $47 billion offer to buy 7-Eleven is “friendly,” not a hostile takeover
item.description: Alimentation Couche-Tard says it is determined to acquire Seven & i Holdings, even after its offer was rejected.

item.title: Europe Expected a Transactional Trump. It Got Something Else.
item.description: Europe had been banking on a United States that wanted to make a deal on tariffs and trade. With little progress in that direction, it’s reluctantly s...

item.title: Live Updates: U.S. Envoys Head to Moscow as Kremlin Aide Casts Doubt on Cease-Fire Offer
item.description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia is weighing a U.S.-backed proposal for a 30-day truce. A Kremlin foreign policy official said such a deal would ...

item.title: How to Watch the ‘Blood Moon’ Total Lunar Eclipse
item.description: Earth’s shadow will block most of the light that illuminates the lunar surface, creating what is known as a blood moon.

item.title: Will TikTok’s new parental control features really work?
item.description: "TikTok must think that every parent is just a complete idiot," said Titania Jordan in a new Instagram reel.

item.title: Bumble Bee Foods Is Accused of Tolerating Forced Labor in Supply Chain
